content: frankie s knitted stuff padded mittens this set of extra warm mittens makes use of the slipped stitch pattern commonly used to reinforce the heels of socks by changing the weight of the yarn three sizes of mittens can be knitted first choose the size you want to knit from the table below these are the actual measurements of the finished mittens when off the hand they will stretch when worn and shorten slightly which is why they look a bit longer and thinner than normal mittens small medium large round hand 16 5 cm / 6½ 19 cm / 7½ 20 cm / 8 total length 20 cm / 8 25 cm / 10 28 cm / 11 cuff 5 cm / 2 6 cm / 2¼ 7 cm / 2¾ thumb 5cm / 2 6 5 cm / 2½ 7 cm / 2¾ the size of the mittens to be knitted determines the yarn and needles to use yarn and needles when choosing yarn it s often better to ignore what it s called and look at the length of the yarn instead this will give a better indication of how thick the yarn is for example the yarns i used for the first two sizes of mittens are both described as dk weight but one is nearly twice as thick as the other the mittens are knitted in the round using two sizes of needles the smaller size for the cuff and the larger for the rest of the mitten i knitted with one long circular needle and the magic loop method but you could use double pointed needles if you prefer i have given two gauge measurements for each size one using the smaller needles and working in k1 p1 rib and the other on the bigger needles following the padded stitch pattern if you want to test your gauge using this stitch pattern you can knit a small sample working back and forth instead of in rounds if you do this remember to purl wrong side row rather than knit them small mittens 25g of a thin yarn with approximately 400 m / 100g i used rico creative melange dk 200 m / 50g 2 5 and 3 mm needles us sizes 1½ and 3 gauge rib - 20 stitches and 20 rounds = 5 cm / 2 padding 15 stitches and 24 rounds = 5 cm / 2 medium mittens 50g of roughly dk weight yarn with about 250 - 300 m / 100g i used stylecraft highland heather dk 272 m / 100g 3 5 and 4 5 mm needles us sizes 4 and 7 gauge rib - 16 stitches and 16 rounds = 5 cm / 2 padding 13 stitches and 20 rounds = 5 cm / 2 large mittens 75g of aran weight yarn with a length of about 200 m / 100g i used hobbycraft soft and smooth aran 390 m / 200g 4 and 5 mm needles us sizes
